alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Orange; Southern Jasper; Southern Newton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued November 26 at 1:32AM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following areas, Hardin, Jefferson, Orange, Southern Jasper and Southern Newton. * WHEN...Until Noon CST today. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Showers and thunderstorms are expected in and near the watch area into late morning. Slow moving storms will be able to produce rainfall rates around two to three inches per hour. Recent rainfall have completely saturated the ground and additional rainfall is expected to run off into creeks... rivers and low lying areas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Jefferson; Orange; Southern Jasper; Southern Newton
